intro: Melicope hivaoaensis, commonly known as the Hivaoa melicope, is a small evergreen tree native to the island of Hivaoa in the Society Islands of French Polynesia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and lance-shaped leaves with a glossy surface. Its flowers are small, fragrant, and white, typically appearing in clusters, while the fruit is a small, round drupe. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
